U.S. Urged to Take Responsibility for Restoration of Environment
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Take Responsibility for Restoration of Environment 
    Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations of south Korea including the Green Federation, the Headquarters of the Movement for a Stop to U.S. Troops' Crimes, the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek reportedly held a press conference in front of the U.S. military base in Ryongsan of Seoul on Feb. 14 to strongly urge the U.S. forces' side to take responsibility for the restoration of the environment in the area of its base before returning it to the south Korean side.
 At the press conference, Ko Ji Son, chief of a team for observing the environment in the U.S. military bases, accused the U.S. forces' side of trying to impose the burden of expenses for the environmental restoration upon the south Korean side despite the fact that the south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" revised in 2001 and a "special memorandum of understanding on the environmental protection" agreed between south Korea and the U.S. in 2003 stipulate that "the U.S. forces' side shall own responsibility for purifying the polluted U.S. military bases."    
 Then the civic and social organizations declared that they would send questionnaires to the U.S. forces' side and the south Korean "government" as regards the reason why the results of the investigation into the pollution of its bases have not yet been opened to the public, its attitude toward the responsibility for the environmental purification, the tolerance limit to the environmental pollution to be purified by it in a responsible manner and others.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies 
    Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Political parties, ministries, organizations and high-ranking officials of different countries sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassies in relevant countries from Feb. 7 to 16 to congratulate leader Kim Jong Il on his birthday.
 Among them were the External Relations Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, the Vietnamese Ministry of Defence, the Central Committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam, the Vietnamese Union of Friendship Organizations, the Vietnam-Korea Friendship Association, the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Club, the All-India Forward Bloc, the Party of Chinese in Malaysia, the People's Party of Cambodia, the FUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia, the deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Arab Socialist Baath Party of Syria, the president of the People's Assembly of Syria, the prime minister of the Cabinet of Syria, the Syrian minister of Defence, the chief of the General Staff of the Syrian army and armed forces, the general secretary of the Syrian Arab Socialist Union Party, the deputy prime minister of Laos who is also foreign minister, the Lao minister of Defence, the chairman of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, the president of the National Assembly of Guinea, the Cambodian minister of state who is also minister of Economy and Finance, the Cambodian minister of state who is also minister of Commerce, the mayor of Phnom Penh, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and the deputy secretary of the National People's Committee of Libya.

South Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon Supports DPRK's Appeal
articles.content:
South Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon Supports DPRK's Appeal 
    Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification (Pomchonghakryon) issued a statement on Feb. 15 in support of the appeal to all the fellow countrymen adopted at a joint meeting of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
 "Let us vigorously forward the patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity under the banner of 'By our nation itself'!"--this is the slogan to be held up in this year's movement for national reunification, the statement said.    
 It noted that the youth and students should vigorously conduct the patriotic movement for independent reunification, holding high the banner of "By our nation itself", the banner of June 15.

Guinean Political Party Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Guinean Political Party Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy
    Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea headed by General Secretary Sekou Konate paid a congratulatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Conakry on Feb. 15 on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 The delegation placed a floral basket before the full-length portrait of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the name of the National Political Bureau of the Party.
 Written on the ribbon of the basket were letters reading "Glory to HE Kim Jong Il. The National Political Bureau of the Party for Unity and Progress".

articles.title: S. Korean Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
S. Korean Delegation Arrives
    Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A south Korean delegation of the youth committees of political parties with Member of the National Assembly from the Uri Party Ri Hwa Yong as its chief head and with the chairpersons of the youth committees of the Democratic Party and the Democratic Workers' Party as its co-heads arrived here Monday.
 The delegation was greeted at the airport by Ri Myong Won, secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and officials concerned.
